Tachyons are things that accelerate faster than light, and as they pass by, objects may seem to move or “rotate” as they pass, even though the objects themselves are not moving.

Pour the liquid butter into a bowl and set it aside, ideally in a cool place.  After a while, the watery liquid will separate from the butter.  Skim the top layer off to get your clarifying butter, which can be poured into a clean jar. The other group members then in turn “invest” a portion of the initial investment money, and so on. prompt: Can you describe how an autonomous car works?
chosen:
One way to think about it is this:  You can make a car without a human driver in two different ways.  The first is to put a robot in the car, which is kind of like a remote-control helicopter.  The robot would have a video camera, some artificial intelligence, and some sensors.  When you are driving, you would be able to see out the window and steer and accelerate and brake with a joystick or other controls, so it’s like you are driving, but you aren’t.  You’d control the robot, and the robot would control the car.  If you wanted to be super safe, you could build an extra sensor in the car that would only drive in the safest conditions, and when there were hazards, or if the car sensed the driver wasn’t doing what they should, then the robot would actually take over control of the car and drive it instead.  This is the safer way, but it would also be kind of slow because the robot would just be doing the exact same thing that you would have done, and if you messed up, the robot would also mess up.

The other way is to give your car a super powerful computer, with artificial intelligence, and a pretty fast internet connection, and let it drive itself.  This car would also have some sensors, but it wouldn’t really need them, because it would always have access to so much more information than you do.  When you are driving, you would choose where you want to go, and your car would use all of its data to come up with the best route and way to get there.  The computer would make all the decisions about how to handle unexpected events and road conditions, and would do the braking and steering and everything.  It’s kind of like having a flying car that is in control of everything, and you just decide where you want to go.  Most people use cars like this, because they’re pretty good and most of the time you don’t really want to do all of that work and risking making a mistake.

prompt: I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering  recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Pakistani dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Aloo Ki Tikki?
chosen:
Sure, Aloo ki Tikki (recipe below). I recommend buying all the ingredients ahead of time. Then you will need to start with step two and have everything chopped and ready by the time you get to step four.

1 onion, finely chopped (5 tablespoons)

5 potatoes (red skinned if possible, they have a sweet taste), cubed

2-3 tomatoes, finely chopped (6-8 tbsp)

1 tsp ginger, grated

1 tsp salt

2-3 cloves of garlic, crushed

1⁄2 tsp red chili powder

2-3 tbsp cumin powder

1 tbsp coriander powder

1 tbsp garam masala

2 tbsp lemon juice

1⁄2 cup (2 oz) coriander, chopped (optional)

Cooking oil

----

Heat cooking oil in a deep pan or kadhai, add the onion, and fry it until it turns light golden.

Remove the onions and drain on a paper towel. Leave the oil in the pan.

Add the tomatoes, ginger, garlic, and salt, stir and cook for about 3 minutes.

Add the chili powder, cumin, coriander, and garam masala. Stir well, and cook for 2 minutes.

Add the potatoes, and cook for 2 minutes.

Turn the heat down, and mix well. Add 2-3 tbsp water, and cook for 8-10 minutes. Keep stirring and checking.

Add the lemon juice. Remove from heat. Mix in the coriander and let it cool a little.

Cut potatoes and tomato and shape into balls.

Heat some cooking oil in a deep pan or kadhai. When the oil is hot, add the potatoes. Fry till they turn light golden brown.

In a paper towel, drain the fried potatoes. Leave the oil in the pan.

In the same oil, add the onion, tomatoes, and fried potatoes.

Stir well, and add 2-3 tbsp water. Cook for 3-4 minutes.

----

So it’s great to use them in situations where these hazards are acceptable. This is commonly the case for flashlights. But if you’re the consumer, you’ll want to be sure that you’re buying LiPo batteries from a manufacturer that actually tests its product for safety. Another thing to consider is that since the chemical reaction in LiPo batteries causes it to decompose to lithium metal, and a little of that metal can cause fires, you’ll also want to take care not to discharge it down to a very low voltage or to handle it in conditions that would cause it to heat up a lot.

prompt: Hi, I just got some sweetbreads from the butcher, but I don't know how to prepare them. Can you give me a good recipe for sweetbreads?
chosen:
Of course!  This recipe should be suitable for several different types of sweetbreads.  

Step 1: First we need to wash and dry the sweetbreads.  You can use a salad spinner or a large bowl and a clean towel.  

Step 2: Next we need to remove all the membranes and some of the tendons, the stringy things that look like tiny white strings.  To do this, simply make a slice along the top of the sweetbread, and scrape out any bits of membrane that come out.  For the tendons, make some cuts on the sides of the sweetbreads, and then just squeeze the flesh around them, it should pop right out.  If you need more guidance, here is a picture of the sweetbreads, and another picture of the stuff that needs to be removed.  

Step 3: Now we're ready to boil the sweetbreads.  You will need an 8x8 inch square pan.  First, cut a small slit in the side of each sweetbread and drain the excess water out.  Then place the sweetbreads in the pan and cover them with water, making sure to leave a gap for steam to escape.  Boil them for 15-20 minutes.  You can test to see if they are done by piercing one with a knife.  

Step 4: Remove the sweetbreads from the water, and let them cool a bit on a clean towel.  Then put them in a plastic ziplock bag and let them rest for at least a day.  This lets the juices drain out of the sweetbreads, making them taste better.  

Step 5: The day after you put the sweetbreads in the plastic bag, you will need to open them and trim off the skin, but do this with your hands (without cutting your fingers!) so you don't cut off too much.  

Step 6: Finally, you are ready to prepare the sweetbreads for eating.  To do this, place the sweetbreads in a hot pan with butter.  Let the sweetbreads cook for 2 minutes on each side.  

Step 7: And that is it!  They should taste delicious.

prompt: How do I make chocolate chip cookies?
chosen:
You can use a basic recipe:

Ingredients:

1 cup unsalted butter, softened

1 cup brown sugar

2 eggs

1 teaspoon vanilla extract

1 3/4 cups flour

1 teaspoon baking powder

1/2 teaspoon salt

1/2 teaspoon baking soda

2 cups chocolate chips

Preparation:

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large bowl, cream together butter and brown sugar. Beat in eggs, one at a time, until fully incorporated. Add vanilla and beat well.

In a medium bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda. Stir until well combined. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, alternating between flour mixture and chocolate chips. 

Bake in preheated oven for 8 to 10 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the centre of the cookies comes out clean.

Ok so my colleague found a recipe on a site called “onegoodthingbyjillee”.com. Here is their recipe for Swordfish a la Siciliana:

Swordfish a la Siciliana

Ingredients:

1 pound swordfish steaks (alternately, use tuna steaks or chicken cutlets)
1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
1/4 cup red wine vinegar
1/4 cup fresh-squeezed lemon juice
3 cloves garlic, finely chopped
1/2 cup fresh flat-leaf parsley, finely chopped
1 teaspoon fresh oregano
1 teaspoon crushed red chili flakes
3/4 cup plain bread crumbs (high-quality, fresh bread crumbs will work best; if they’re very dry, add 1 tablespoon water to the crumbs to help them stick to the fish)
salt and freshly ground pepper

Method:

1. Place a skillet over medium heat and add the oil, vinegar, lemon juice, and garlic.
2. Bring the mixture to a boil, and reduce the heat to low.
3. Let simmer while you make the breading.
4. In a shallow bowl, mix together the parsley, oregano, crushed red chili flakes, and bread crumbs.
5. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
6. Dip the swordfish into the sauce, coating both sides.
7. Press the fish into the bread crumb mixture to cover completely.
8. Place the swordfish on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 375°F for 15 minutes.
9. Once the fish is cooked through, remove it from the oven and cover with the remaining bread crumb mixture.
10. Return it to the oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes.
11. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving, with lemon wedges on the side for garnish.

The long-term consequences of sitting for too long are very few, assuming that your back is properly supported when you are sitting down.  Back pain that is caused by prolonged sitting in an office is usually a result of bad posture.  Try these tips to avoid back pain and problems:

-   Maintain good posture.  Try to maintain a straight back, shoulders down, stomach sucked in, and keep your head up.
-   Use a proper chair and/or a lumbar support cushion.  Be sure to get up and move frequently, to break up the stress on your spine.  A good tip is to get up every 20 minutes, move around and stretch, and return to your chair.
-   Don’t sit cross-legged, or with feet on chair.  Sit in a chair with your feet flat on the floor.  You can also try to put your feet on a footstool.

chosen:
To me, social media are the platforms that enable communication with the mass public.  In the past, these platforms have been limited by the speed at which information could travel.  For example, a written message could be sent by mail from New York to California in six weeks; it took less than a day to send an electronic message (such as an e-mail) from New York to California via a satellite, but if you wanted to communicate with someone on the other side of the world, you had to be willing to wait for an entire week.

In the 1970s, a technique called packet switching was developed to allow electronic data to be transmitted at much higher speeds.  This was later enhanced by the development of the World Wide Web, which is a sort of map of all the connected web servers in the world.  Clients can send a request to a web server, which then transmits the message to its own server’s link to another server, which then transmits it to its own link, and so on, until it reaches the client.

prompt: Can sitting down for too long do harm to my back? I am on the computer for 8-10 hours a day and am worried about the long term consequences.
chosen:
The long-term consequences of sitting for too long are very few, assuming that your back is properly supported when you are sitting down.  Back pain that is caused by prolonged sitting in an office is usually a result of bad posture.  Try these tips to avoid back pain and problems:

-   Maintain good posture.  Try to maintain a straight back, shoulders down, stomach sucked in, and keep your head up.
-   Use a proper chair and/or a lumbar support cushion.  Be sure to get up and move frequently, to break up the stress on your spine.  A good tip is to get up every 20 minutes, move around and stretch, and return to your chair.
-   Don’t sit cross-legged, or with feet on chair.  Sit in a chair with your feet flat on the floor.  You can also try to put your feet on a footstool.
-   Avoid prolonged sitting on the floor.

250 g beef (cut into 1cm cubes)
2 onions (sliced)
3 cloves of garlic (finely chopped)
1 bunch of coriander (finely chopped)
3 medium tomatoes (sliced)
1-2 tbsp ghee
Salt, to taste

You can start by frying the meat and onions in the ghee. Then add in the garlic and coriander, and cover with water. Let it simmer for a few minutes.

In a separate pan, fry the tomatoes. When the meat is almost done, add the tomatoes, salt, and mix everything together. Add in water, if needed, and cook for another five minutes. If you like, you can add a little yogurt to the gravy at the end.

This is one of my personal favorites. You can also add cumin and coriander to the meat while frying.

chosen:
There are many variations on pumpkin pie recipes, but here’s one of my favorites:

4 eggs

3⁄4 cup pumpkin puree

1 cup sugar

1⁄2 cup brown sugar

2 cups all-purpose flour

1⁄2 teaspoon baking powder

1⁄2 teaspoon salt

1 teaspoon cinnamon

1 teaspoon ground cloves

1 teaspoon nutmeg

1 teaspoon allspice

1⁄4 teaspoon ground ginger

2/3 cup butter, melted

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl, beat eggs. Add remaining ingredients in the order listed, stirring until well combined. Pour into a 9-inch pie pan and bake for 45 minutes to one hour. Cool to room temperature before serving. Enjoy!

Sure, I have the recipe at hand:

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cover the corn husks in warm water, then drain them and let them dry a little. Cut the tops and bottoms off the corn husks so they will lie flat. Mix together corn masa (corn flour), corn water, and salt until smooth and thick. Put a small amount of the masa on the center of each husk. Fold the sides of the husk up over the masa and, holding the husk, form a rough square or rectangle.

Put the husks in a skillet filled with a thin layer of lard or oil. Fry them over low heat, turning frequently, for 10 minutes. Remove them from the skillet and place them in a warm place (such as an oven with the light turned on) for an hour to dry. Heat the lard in the skillet and fry the nacatamales again. Turn once.

A few minutes before serving, place the fried nacatamales in a 375 degree oven.

Remove the husks from the oven, and using a sharp knife, make an incision in each nacatamale and pour about a tablespoon of lard on top. Spread the lard with a spoon or butter knife to make a layer an inch thick. Place each nacatamale on a plate and top with a bit of grated cheddar. Garnish with fresh cilantro sprigs.

200g chopped onions

2 tbsp flour

1 large tin chopped tomatoes

4 tbsp oil

Salt

prompt: How can I treat sore thighs from running?
chosen:
Running is a fantastic workout, and most people will get sore legs at first.  After a few runs, you’ll find that your muscles and skin toughen up and you can go further and run faster.  There are some basic things you can do that will help you get better faster:

1.  Ice baths, where you fill a large bath tub with water, add ice, and soak your legs in the bath for ten to fifteen minutes.  This will make the skin and muscles tighter, and will help them heal faster.
2.  Massage.  Most people are not good at self-massage, but with a little practice you can rub your muscles to ease pain, and speed healing.
3.  Wearing compression clothing can help prevent chafing, while also giving a bit of added support for your muscles and joints.
4.  If you do a lot of running, it’s a good idea to invest in a new pair of shoes every few months.  Runners often put a lot of stress on the plantar fascia, which is a small and often ignored tendon that stretches from the bottom of the foot up to the base of the toes.  You can protect it with a new pair of shoes, as well as some custom orthotics for your feet that might be recommended by a physical therapist.  New shoes can also be more comfortable.
5.  Take care of your feet.  Runners usually end up getting heel blisters, or some form of calluses on their feet.  You can relieve this by massaging the bottom of your feet and applying antiseptic cream, or you can get insoles to make it more comfortable.  Good shoes can also help.
6.  If you’re getting hip and knee pain, it’s worth seeing a doctor for some exercises and advice.  Your joints are weak, and stretching and warm-up exercises can be especially important.
rejected: Running is a fantastic workout, and most people will get sore legs at first. After a few runs, you’ll find that your muscles and skin toughen up and you can go further and run faster.[Reset]
label: help
